issues.description: The problem statement and template refer to an interface named 'Milkable' (with method messageOnMilk()), but the solution repository defines and uses an interface named 'Dairy' instead. Additionally, the solution contains an empty Milkable.java file. Concretely: the UML and template/Main.java expect Milkable (problem_statement.md lines 51-53 and template Main.java lines 23-24), while the solution implements Dairy (solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Dairy.java) and has Goat and Seal implement Dairy rather than Milkable (Goat.java, Seal.java). This type/name mismatch between the specified interface and the solution will confuse students about which interface to implement and prevents the solution from serving as a correct structural reference.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the interface name/type across all artifacts. The simplest fix is to update the solution repository to use the interface name 'Milkable' as specified in the problem statement and template: rename or replace Dairy.java with a Milkable.java that declares String messageOnMilk(); and have Goat and Seal implement Milkable (update their implements clauses accordingly). Also remove the empty Milkable.java file (or populate it consistently). Alternatively, change the problem statement and template to refer to 'Dairy' instead of 'Milkable' — but prefer updating the solution to match the problem/template so students are not confused.

issues.description: The problem statement and template refer to the interface that exposes messageOnMilk() as 'Milkable' (UML and example code in Main), but the solution implementation introduces an interface named 'Dairy' and has the animal classes implement 'Dairy'. This is a direct name mismatch for the same conceptual entity (the milk-capable interface). The solution also contains an empty Milkable.java file, which increases confusion. Students will expect to find/implement 'Milkable' from the exercise description and template; finding 'Dairy' instead creates a mapping barrier and may cause failing tests or wasted time.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the interface name across artifacts. Rename the solution's 'Dairy' interface to 'Milkable' (and have Goat and Seal implement Milkable), or alternatively update the problem/template to use 'Dairy' — preferably change the solution to 'Milkable' to match the problem statement and template. Also remove or populate the empty Milkable.java to avoid further confusion.
